Package com.penthera.virtuososdk.service

Class VirtuosoForegroundServiceHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.BroadcastReceiver
      • com.penthera.virtuososdk.service.VirtuosoForegroundServiceHandler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    VirtuosoServiceStarter
    public abstract class VirtuosoForegroundServiceHandler
extends BroadcastReceiver
    The VirtuosoForegroundServiceHandler is a Broadcast Receiver based class which provides the base framework for starting the Download2Go service from the client application. The service is designed to run in a separate process, and to run as a foreground service while downloading so that it can continue to download assets while the app is in the background.

    In order to run as a foreground service, a Notification must be shown. The notification needs to be generated from the client application but it needs to be set in the service when it enters the foreground state. In order to achieve this, a minimum of the initial notification must be passed across a process boundary from the client application to the service. Further updates to the notification are required to improve the user experience by showing download actions and progress.

    This abstract class provides the methods which can be used to provide a notification to the service. There is one key method which must be overridden to provide the app notifications and to handle broadcast intents from the service requesting updates to the notification. An initial notification is always delivered via this route in order that the SDK can make the notification available prior to starting the service. The reason for this approach is that the service must start foreground mode, with a valid notification, within a timeout period, otherwise the Android OS will kill the service process.

    Following initial startup of the service, the SDK uses IForegroundNotificationProvider to register a class which will be instantiated within the service process and generate notifications directly.

    • Method Detail

      • shouldRemoteUpdateNotification

        public boolean shouldRemoteUpdateNotification​(Context aContext,
                                              Intent aIntent)
        This method determines whether notification update requests received within the service starter should be passed through to getForegroundServiceNotification() and result in a new notification being passed back to the service. This approach to notification updates is deprecated and the method will not commonly be used.
        This method may be overridden in order to filter on specific intent actions in cases where a notification needs to be generated from the main service starter process and not from within the service. A complimentary method within IForegroundNotificationProvider enables filtering within the service to prevent notifications from being generated on specific intent actions.
        Parameters:
        aContext - The context which would be passed to getForegroundServiceNotification(Context context, Intent forIntent )
        aIntent - The intent which would be passed to getForegroundServiceNotification(Context context, Intent forIntent )
        Returns:
        True if the notification should be generated and passed to the service, False if the request should be ignored.
        See Also:
        IForegroundNotificationProvider.shouldUpdateForegroundServiceNotificationOnIntent(Context, Intent)

      • getForegroundServiceNotification

        public abstract Notification getForegroundServiceNotification​(Context context,
                                                              @Nullable
                                                              Intent forIntent)
        This method is required to return a valid notification each time it is called. The notification will be used as the foreground notification for the service, if the method returns null then the download service may not be able to go into foreground mode and continue downloading when the app is in the background.
        This method works in combination with IForegroundNotificationProvider. If a valid class is returned from getAssetForegroundServiceNotification then that method is used to request all notification updates related to asset downloads and the download engine state. If not then this method will be called for each notification.
        In either case, this method is called to get a generic foreground notification when the foreground service is first started. That notification will be used where the service goes into foreground mode for reasons other than downloading content. For instance, the service uses foreground mode to protect itself from being shut down prematurely when it is servicing push notification actions or deleting content in the background after expiry.
        There are some limitations on what can be shown within a notification returned via this method because it is passed across process boundaries. The Notification object implements Parcelable, and in this case it will be added as a Parcellable extra to an Intent. There is a size limit on the total size of objects passing between processes in Android, and that will be applied to this notification.
        Parameters:
        context - A context which can be used in generating the Notification
        forIntent - An intent containing the details of the notification required, can be null if the service is being started / restarted and no download context is known.
        Returns:
        The notification, which will be passed over a process boundary to be used by the download service.

      • getForegroundServiceNotificationProvider

        public Class getForegroundServiceNotificationProvider()
        Deprecated.
        This has been replaced with a manifest entry to specify the class implemented IForegroundNotificationProvider.
        This method has been deprecated under the architectural changes for Android 12. The class implementing IForegroundNotificationProvider should now be specified using a meta-data entry in the manifest with the name "com.penthera.virtuososdk.notification.provider.impl". The class can be instantiated both:
        • In the client process prior to starting a foreground service when the application is in the foreground, and
        • Within the service if it is started from within WorkManager to complete background processes.


        This method enables the app to provide a class implementing IForegroundNotificationProvider which will be instantiated within the download service and used for generating Notifications during asset download. This method simply returns the class definition, which will be passed to the service. If a non-null response is provided then the class will be instantiated within the service process and requests for notifications will be sent to it instead of being directed to the getForegroundServiceNotification() method. Notifications generated via that class will not be passed over a process boundary and do not have any size limits imposed by the Parcellable property. The provided class must use a default constructor. Care and consideration should be given to the fact that the class instance will exist in another process to the UI and will need to create duplicate resources within that process for any helper classes used to generate the notifications, such as image loaders or database references.
        If a class is provided which does not implement the interface then this will be logged and the provided class will be ignored.
        Returns:
        The class which should be instantiated within the service to use for notifications.

      • onReceive

        public void onReceive​(Context context,
                      Intent aIntent)
        The broadcast receiver implementation for the framework, does not need to be overridden.
        Specified by:
        onReceive in class BroadcastReceiver
        Parameters:
        context - The context provided with the broadcast
        aIntent - The intent
